availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Jane Wilson Sechrest in Grant County on August 29, 1846. Father of James M. Sechrest, Thomas W. Sechrest, Arbelle Sechrest, Nebraska Sechrest, and John W. Sechrest. Owned four enslaved persons in Grant County in 1850. Farmer in Grant County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Grant County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 107.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Grant County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 48.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Grant County Marriages, Film #000266220.
